image.altText: A profile photo sexual assault survivor Megan with garden behind her

items.synopsis: Megan was a quick-witted and mischievous child, but when she was five, a predator entered her home and stamped out all that made her who she was. He didn't leave her life for 30 years.

title.children: 'A wolf in shepherd's clothes': Megan's babysitter was a paedophile priest who left a lasting impact on her life

image.altText: A man in military greens stands facing the camera.

items.synopsis: Ukraine has long been warning of a spring counteroffensive and despite next week marking a new season, Kyiv has a deadly warning for those Russian soldiers inside its border.

title.children: Ukraine has been promising a counteroffensive. One general warns Russia will 'envy the dead'

image.altText: Composite image of a blazing building and an old woman in a chair

items.synopsis: The daughter of the man who once owned the RC Henderson hat factory in Surry Hills, where she worked as a teen, was watching on television as the historic site was reduced to rubble.

title.children: 'I couldn't believe it': Liz Henderson watched in horror as Sydney fire destroyed family's legacy

image.altText: A graphic of a red up arrow next to a percentage sign, overlaid on a street view of a row of houses.

items.synopsis: Around half of fixed rate borrowers whose low-rate home loans are expiring over the next two years are planning to leave their current lender, but it's those customers who can't that might prove a bigger problem for the banks, new research finds.

title.children: 'Inevitable' home loan arrears will rise as 'mortgage prisoners' struggle with rate surge, analyst says

image.altText: A man wearing a red shirt shakes hands with a woman wearing a headscarf surrounded by authorities.

items.synopsis: An Australian man accused of going on a naked, drunken rampage in a conservative Indonesian province will avoid jail after reaching a compensation deal with his alleged victim.

title.children: Australian man accused of drunken rampage in Indonesia reaches $25k agreement with victim

image.altText: A woman looks up at a large transmission tower.

items.synopsis: Energy costs are set to rise, once again. Here's a breakdown of what's happening, along with answers to some of your burning energy questions.

title.children: Electricity prices are rising in July. Here's why, and how you can cut costs

image.altText: A man with long hair and a beard next to another man with short, grey hair and a business suit.

items.synopsis: Billionaire Mike Cannon-Brookes claims control of the controversial Sun Cable solar export project, winning a bidding war after falling out with his former project partner, Andrew Forrest.

title.children: Mike Cannon-Brookes wins control of Sun Cable after solar farm fall-out with Andrew Forrest

image.altText: A group of West Papua rebels with many holding guns and wearing traditional headgear, New Zealand pilot holding West Papua flag.

items.synopsis: Rebels in Indonesia's Papua region threatened to shoot a New Zealand pilot they took hostage in February if countries do not comply with their demand to start independence talks within two months, a new video released by the group showed.

title.children: West Papuan separatists threaten to shoot New Zealand pilot hostage unless independence talks begin

image.altText: Red Cross Lifeblood's Elizabeth Connolly holding FMT product

items.synopsis: Poo donations are being used to treat a deadly gut infection, with trials recording a huge cure rate. Donors say its easier than giving blood, but there's not enough of them.

title.children: Just as giving blood saves lives, poo donations are also needed for lifesaving transplants

image.altText: Four men in army gear stand and look at building burning after an airstrike.

items.synopsis: At least two people have been killed and 23 injured in a Russian missile strike on a medical clinic in the eastern Ukrainian city of Dnipro, the regional governor says.

title.children: Russian rocket hits Ukrainian medical clinic, killing two and injuring 23

image.altText: Packs of pads on shelves.

items.synopsis: When women are struggling to buy period products, and boomers are sitting on wads of cash, there's a crisis in the economy – and it's harming Australians' health and wellbeing, writes David Taylor.

title.children: When women can't afford period products and boomers are counting their savings, there's a crisis in the economy

image.altText: A man sitting in a car smiles.

items.synopsis: Abdel-Aziz Hussein Ali's plan was to hide in the boot of the car while the instructor drove to the ex-girlfriend's house, and pick her up.

title.children: Brisbane man jailed for kidnapping driving instructor at knifepoint in plot to abduct girlfriend

image.altText: Close up picture of a woman with short white hair, wearing glasses, under a black umbrella.

items.synopsis: The tumultuous end of Indonesian strongman Suharto's 32-year regime in 1998 was punctuated by widespread riots with mobs targeting ethnic Chinese and a deadly crackdown on student protests. Twenty-five years on, the victims and their families are still fighting for justice.

title.children: Victims of Indonesia's 1998 violence continue to fight for justice 25 years on

image.altText: A view of an open door on a plane.

items.synopsis: South Korean police detain a man who opened the door of an Asiana Airlines plane minutes before it was due to land in the city of Daegu.

title.children: 'I thought the plane was going to explode': Emergency door opened mid-air during Korean flight

image.altText: The Roy siblings stand shoulder to shoulder at a funeral.

items.synopsis: The finale of Succession airs on Monday but this is not a power battle between siblings for Waystar Royco. It's a fight for the missing love of a cruel parent. And that's the joy and horror of watching this remarkable show, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: Want to know who's going to 'win' Succession? You're asking the wrong question

image.altText: Two men sit side-by-side leaning on each other and smiling

items.synopsis: A former Israeli soldier and ex-Palestinian freedom fighter have dedicated their lives to promoting peace after their young daughters were killed in the ongoing violence in their homeland.

title.children: Fathers from both sides of the Israel-Palestine conflict united by 'unbearable pain'

image.altText: actor Hugh Grant smiles while wearing a blue button up shirt and a navy blue tie.

items.synopsis: The actor claims The Sun used private investigators to tap into his phone and burgle his home.

title.children: Hugh Grant given green light to sue The Sun newspaper over phone-tapping, burglary allegations

image.altText: Two Type C orcas in Bass Straight.

items.synopsis: A sail boat has been severely damaged by a pod of orcas, adding to a number of attacks on Spanish coasts.

title.children: Pod of orcas rams sail boat off the Spanish coast, the latest in dozens of attacks on vessels recorded this year

image.altText: A woman dressed up in dark green one-shoulder dress at a press event.

items.synopsis: Gynaecologist Caitlin Bernard, the doctor who drew national attention for revealing she had performed an abortion on a 10-year-old rape victim, was reprimanded and fined by a medical board for violating patient privacy laws.

title.children: US doctor reprimanded and fined for talking about 10-year-old rape victim's abortion

image.altText: A Parramatta Eels NRL player holds the ball while being tackled by a North Queensland opponent.

items.synopsis: A late Mitchell Moses try leads Parramatta to a much-needed 24-16 win over North Queensland, breathing life into its stuttering NRL campaign.

title.children: Moses leads Eels to hard-fought win over Cowboys

image.altText: A dog on a stand with film cameras in front of it.

items.synopsis: Photographer Eric Gaillard has been taking photos at the festival since 1981, when it was a small and intimate affair.

title.children: 'An incredible experience': Forty years of Cannes film festivals through one man's camera lens

image.altText: Two racing drivers, the one on the left wearing a black shirt, the other wearing red, talking to each other

items.synopsis: This weekend's Monaco Grand Prix has been overshadowed by massive speculation about Lewis Hamilton's future — but what is the truth behind the rumours?

title.children: Speculation is rife that Lewis Hamilton is joining Ferrari — but how did the rumours start?

image.altText: Bicup of tap water.

items.synopsis: Routine testing of water at Atherton Hospital and Yarrabah Health Facility picked up the lead contamination, according to Queensland Health

title.children: High levels of lead detected in water at two Queensland Health facilities

image.altText: Women in lycra and helmets in racing gear line up at starting line for road cycling race.

items.synopsis: British Cycling became the latest sports governing body to ban transgender women from competing in the female category of competitive events on Friday, tightening its rules around participation to "safeguard the fairness" of the sport.

title.children: British Cycling bans transgender women from competing in female category

image.altText: composite image of a man and woman at their wedding, and a dog

items.synopsis: Carla Benson is in a critical condition after allegedly being hit by a drink driver who fled the incident, and her beloved dog Chopper is still missing.

title.children: While Carla fights for life after an alleged hit-and-run, her family is searching for her dog

image.altText: A sign that says Calvary Hospital on a sunny day.

items.synopsis: The ACT branch of the Australian Nursing and Midwifery Federation says its members were not consulted about the planned government takeover of Calvary Public Hospital and were only told of it two weeks ago.

title.children: Lack of consultation about Calvary takeover in breach of enterprise agreement, nurses' union says

image.altText: A wide shot of the exterior of Rockingham hospital.

items.synopsis: A man is sent to prison for more than two years for bashing an elderly man in an altercation which was started by the attacker's eight-year-old son.

title.children: Man who bashed 91-year-old in assault sparked by attacker's young son jailed for more than two years

image.altText: The queen in a tiara and jewells speaking with a ban with brown hair wearing a tuxedo

items.synopsis: Newly released FBI documents reveal a possible IRA threat to Queen Elizabeth II's life during her official visit to the United States in 1983.

title.children: FBI files uncover threats to kill Queen on a 1980s trip to US

image.altText: A close-up of a corporate pwc logo on a reflective glass building panel.

items.synopsis: When Senate Estimates this week turned its basilisk stare upon the trembling, corpulent form of PwC Australia, there was a definite "fistfight in the chess club" energy, writes Annabel Crabb.

title.children: The breathtaking PwC tax scandal stokes simmering outrage as the Voice clears its throat

image.altText: Logo Open AI is in white on black phone screen in front of a white computer screen with words.

items.synopsis: Home Affairs says it has allowed supervised experimentation with ChatGPT in some of its divisions, including its refugee and cyber teams, as the department boss awaits broader direction from government.

title.children: Home Affairs experimenting with ChatGPT in refugee and cyber divisions

image.altText: a family of four people hugging and looking at the camera

items.synopsis: Steve Pampalian's family is struggling to comprehend what prompted his violent behaviour in Sydney's lower north shore, and want to know why officers' body-worn cameras were not switched on.

title.children: Family pay tribute to 'sweet soul' shot dead by police, question why body-cameras were switched off

image.altText: A woman wearing a face mask with the word 'silenced' written on it

items.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on the South Australian government to ease its crackdown on protests, with unions, human rights campaigners and community groups upping their fight against the proposed law changes.

title.children: Hundreds march through Adelaide CBD calling for government to ease its crackdown on protests

image.altText: Two side by side headshots of ABC chair Ita Buttrose and journalist Stan Grant speaking at public events

items.synopsis: ABC chair Ita Buttrose says Australians need to reflect upon their "abhorrent" and "unacceptable" behaviour on social media, following the treatment of high-profile Indigenous journalist Stan Grant.

title.children: ABC chair Ita Buttrose calls racist treatment of Stan Grant 'abhorrent'

image.altText: A black and white photo of nine children with shovels standing in a paddock.

items.synopsis: Former British child migrants are demanding King Charles III step in, after they were told they may receive just 1 per cent of their compensation claims for childhood abuse.

title.children: Former UK child migrants urge King Charles to intervene after 'disgusting' Fairbridge compensation offer

image.altText: A bat in a vivid green tree.

items.synopsis: Piles of dead bats are turning up at schools and parks in Katherine, prompting a warning to residents about the risk of contracting a potentially fatal disease.

title.children: NT rangers investigate mystery cause behind fruit bat deaths
